descriptions: Student does not demonstrate an understanding of place value (tens and ones).
Student shows limited understanding of place value, struggling to identify the tens and ones digits.
Student can identify tens and ones digits but struggles to explain their value or compare numbers.
Student demonstrates a basic understanding of place value, able to identify and explain the value of tens and ones digits in isolation.
Student demonstrates a strong understanding of place value, accurately explaining the value of tens and ones digits and using this understanding to compare numbers.
Student demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of place value, accurately explaining the value of tens and ones digits, comparing numbers, and justifying their comparisons.
Student cannot compare two-digit numbers accurately.
Student attempts to compare numbers but makes frequent errors.
Student can compare numbers with guidance but struggles independently.
Student can accurately compare two-digit numbers in most cases but may make occasional errors.
Student consistently and accurately compares two-digit numbers.
Student consistently and accurately compares two-digit numbers and can explain the reasoning behind the comparison.
Student does not use the symbols >, =, and < correctly or does not use them at all.
Student uses the symbols inconsistently and often incorrectly.
Student can sometimes use the symbols correctly with prompting.
Student generally uses the symbols correctly but may make occasional errors.
Student consistently uses the symbols >, =, and < correctly to represent comparisons.
Student consistently uses the symbols correctly and can explain why a particular symbol is appropriate for a given comparison.
